# The `FilePermissionsApplier` Class Reference

## Description {#details}

FilePermssionsApplier helps to copy permissions from an input file to an output one.

It memorizes the status of the input file and can apply permissions and dates to the output file.

Definition at line 82 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileutilities-h">FileUtilities.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### apply() {#a958cd3b9790b98d062b8e5fb5ebc32e6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error FilePermissionsApplier::apply (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> OutputFilename, bool CopyDates=false, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/fs/#ac56b6ec1078927bdd9b65f7ba8fbda82">sys::fs::perms</a> &gt; OverwritePermissions=std::nullopt)</>}>
Apply stored permissions to the <code>OutputFilename</code>.

Copy LastAccess and ModificationTime if <code>CopyDates</code> is true. Overwrite stored permissions if <code>OverwritePermissions</code> is specified.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileutilities-h/#l00090">90</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/fileutilities-h">FileUtilities.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/fileutilities-cpp/#l00284">284</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/fileutilities-cpp">FileUtilities.cpp</a>.
